column1: Course change! gasped white-haired Stevens. "Good God!"The ship had reached the midpoint of its flight. The bells had sounded
column2: warning every soul on it to take shelter
column3: to strap themselves in their pressure bunks against the deadly stress of acceleration as the ship reversed itself and began to slow its headlong plunge into Callisto. But the two men had not heeded.The small steering rockets flashed briefly. The men were thrust bruisingly against the side of the corridor as the rocket spun lazily on its axis. The side jets flared once more to halt the spin
column4: when the one-eighty turn was completed
column5: and the men were battered against the opposite wall
column8: still struggling.Then the main drive bellowed into life again
column9: and the ship began to battle against its own built-up acceleration. The corridor floor rose up with blinking speed to smite them—And the lights went out in a burst of crashing pain for Peter Duane.
